DataElement.preferredName: Organ System Lung Symptom Shortness of Breath Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that describes what activities cause an individual to have shortness of breath.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system._One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for 17-C-0027 Chronic GVHD Review of Systems History Screening form. mc 1/11/17

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

PermissibleValues.value: Using supplemental oxygen at any time
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Use Supplemental Oxygen at Any Time

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Use Supplemental Oxygen at Any Time
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To put into action or service.: Something added to complete a thing, make up for a deficiency, or extend or strengthen the whole; serving to complete or make an addition.: A colorless, odorless gas. It is needed for animal and plant life. Oxygen that is breathed in enters the blood from the lungs and travels to the tissues.: At any time in the past, present, or future.

Concepts.definition: To put into action or service.
Something added to complete a thing, make up for a deficiency, or extend or strengthen the whole; serving to complete or make an addition.
An element with atomic symbol O, atomic number 8, and atomic weight 16.
At any time in the past, present, or future.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: After Climbing One Flight of Stairs

ValueMeaning.preferredName: After Climbing One Flight of Stairs
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: A question about climbing one flight of stairs.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
A question about climbing one flight of stairs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period of being still or inactive.
